ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great introduction to American political behavior. Well-done syllabus. Highly recommended.
Yes. It covers the major topics of American Political Behavior.
The material covered is essential for Americanists and useful for Comparativists and Theorists. The workload is appropriate and manageable.

This is a thorough overview of the major issues in American political behavior. I would consider it necessary for anyone planning on being an Americanist, and I think it would be extremely useful for comparativists (both substantively and because it showcases some of the most advanced methodology in political science) and certain theorists (those who use psychology in their research).

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I particularly was interested in the week covering retrospective voting.
Very useful field seminar. Provides insights into broader issues in the literature as well as edge-cutting research.
